text:
On tap, @T-Anker, Praga. Viaje 03/2017
Color negro opaco, el aromo maltas tostadas con algo de caco, sabor cafetoso con notas a malta

(Keg at T-Anker, 20160612)The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized, lightly brown and it lasted long. Aroma had burnt malts, caramel and cocoa. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were burnt malts, grass, ash, chocolate and bitterness. Aftertaste was burnt and bitter. A very tasty schwarz.
On draft at the brewery tap. Dark, caramelled, chocolatey, avoiding sweet, with a slightly leathery edge. For me, up there with the U Fleku classic as the best of the Czech dark lagers so far.

Draft at the brewery pub. Only had a half-liter of this, but might have to leave this place with more. Bridges dark caramel and chocolate, light coffee, with just enough bitterness and body. Rich and flavorful, especially for its strength. I always think I want Svetly and then I drink a great Tmavý...
Tap. Pours Black with a tan head. Aroma of toffe, cream, roast, licorioce a hint of dried fruit. Maby a tad too old or not a perfect balanced. But stil decent.

Pitch black, low creamy beige head. Aroma of milk chocolate and sour cream. Palate medium with moderate carbonation. Taste of milk chocolate, toffee and salty caramel. Well balanced and enjoyable mild schwarzbier, ideal for ladies :-)

Draught @ T-anker, Prague. Pours very dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma of hard roasted malt, light coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, light sourness, some nuts. Flavor is light sweet, malt, toast, caramel, chocolate, no sourness here. Medium body, average carbonation. 250815

20/VII/15 - 50cl bottle from a trade @ home - BB: 30/VII/15 (2015-948)  Thanks to motelpogo for the trade!
Clear dark brown beer, beige creamy head, pretty stable, bit adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: very roasted, lactose sweetness, some caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: mocha, caramel, sourish touch, grains, soft bitterness, some coffee. Aftertaste: very malty, mocha, dark chocolate.

Keg at the Brewery in Pilzen Day 3 of Fergus and Sarahs Czech jaunt. 1/10/14. Opaque black coloured pour with a lasting mid tan head. Aroma is nice earthy charcoal, charred wood, hedgerow and treacle. Flavour is composed of creamy, stale coffee, earthy bark, and some berry / raspberry. Palate is creamy with a fairly full body, moderate carbonation. Interesting well made beer. Nice and rustic.
From tap at Purmistr 11.12.14. Black. Foamy and persistent.beige head. Aroma and taste of dark croquant, caramel and coffee.

On tap.
Dark brown colour, creamy beige head, which leaves a thin film behind.
Nose of mild butter, fruits and chocolate.
Nice refined aroma conating brown sugar, dark fruits, butter, chocolate and mild roasted malt, mouthfeel is creamy.
Sweetbitter finish with dark choco underpainted by hints of hops.
Good.

Draught
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, 
Appearance-brown, clear, tan foam, 
Taste-lightly sour, lightly bitter, light sweetness, 
Palate-light body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good
On tap. Dark brown beer with beige head. Tastes sweet and on the lower end like coffee. Creamy palate. Decent dark beer.
Draught @ Brewpub, Plzen. Pours dark brown with a creamy beige head. Nuts, chocolate, licorice and vague roast. Chewy, creamy and delicious. Waauuw. Amazing! Kick ass brewery!

20cl pour at the brewpub. Pours a watery, but translucent, cola brown with some creamy, lacing, beige head. Nose is heavy on the chocolate and bread, a little dusty too. Big, sweet, chocolate flavor, malt, light cracker, licorice. Dry finish.

Bottle from brewery ; Pilsen ; CZ ; Malt,caramel,chocolate,fruit and heavy roasted aroma ; Dark brown color with smaller head ; Sweet taste with longer finish ; Slightly dry ; Medium body ; Pleasant Tmavy.

Bottle shared by Ryan. Very dark brownish pour with an off-white head. Nose is buttery and roasty. A touch of graham cracker, some charcoal, fig, and chocolate. The flavor is quite heavy on the roast and butter. Overly sweet dark fruits, some caramel, graham cracker, and charcoal.

500mL thanks to mowbeer. Clear deep cola dark ruby pour. Minimal foam. Nose is heavy butter, big dairy and diacetyl. Taste is creamed coffee, surprisingly good with vanilla. Slightly oily body and richness for 4.8%.
Aroma- molasses, maple, wood, burnt marshmallow.  Taste-  sweet, roasty, nutty.  Dark brown with large creamy head.  Palate- light, refreshing, full flavored

courtesy of Vladi and Marco - pours a very dark brown beer with a modest foam left; toasted malts in the nose with hints of cola and hazelnuts; medium-bodied, tart and gently sourish; pretty dry malty finish with notes of black cherries and hazelnuts - not really convincing

Bottle from the brewery. Aroma is actual caramel, roasted malt, very tempting. Some raisins, minor milk chocolate. Rather sweet expectations.  Head is brown and quickly disappearing, colour is very dark brown, almost black. Taste is medium roasted with light coffee. What annoys me is dirty sourness. The beer had been stored in fridge all the time (and not very long) so I guess this should not be the problem. Something went wrong here anyway. I am a bit generous and hope to rerate in the future,

Served at Purkmistr Restaurant in 2011.  Almost black, with reddish mahogany highlights and a dark tan head. 

Aroma: mainly toasted malts, with less dark malt aroma than expected, let alone any burnt odors. Hints of chocolate and dried dark fruits, but no coffee.  Taste of medium roasted malt with dried fruit and coffee overtones. Medium body with light but adequate carbonation. Smooth. 

O - quite enjoyable, if not particularly memorable, bold or distinctive. Easy to drink.

draft at the source.  cola, date and plum nose with a small amount of powdered yeast.   caramel focused flavor, medium body with pronounced syrupiness. low bitterness, low acid. comes across more of a polotmavy with signs of that black patent malt char/soy character expected in tmavy.

A - very dark, almost black and seems like hazy and full, not watery
S - smooth chocolate and coffee with malt
T - fantastic coffee taste with with coffee bitterness
M - nice carbonation, full body
D - this is very drinkable, however since there is so much coffee in its taste, youre kind of limited by being "over-coffeed"

On tap @ the brewpub. Thanks to Bohemian Beer Tours for this event.
Pours pitch black with a big tan head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Taste is full of roasted malts, even some tar and liquorice, coffee and dark chocolate, slightly bitter towards the end, but most noticeable is the roasted flavours, lovely beer.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Starts malty, a bit smoky, but also quite fruity like plums and berries. Finish more and more sourish. Not my favourite.

Near black colored with little beige head. Roasted and licoricy aroma with coffee dominating. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is even more roasted with licorice too, aftertaste dries nicely. Fine dunkel.

(draught, at the brewpub) clear dark ruby colour with a creamy tan head. unbalanced aroma of butterscotch, sherry and charcoal. flavour is heavy caramel and toffee, cappuccino and dry toasted malts. medium body with smooth carbonation and a long roasted-bitter finish. like a big chocolate dessert.
Draught at the brewpub. Fruity aroma. Almost black colour. Stable light brown head. The flavour is quite roasted, a little burnt. But still quite mellow.

On tap. Completely opaque black with an orange hue and a creamy, light brown head leaving a neat lacework. Aroma of hard roasted malt and coffee. Medium body with sweet hard roasted malts and a little burned caramel. Dry, lightly burned finish. 270608
Almost black with large beige head. Sweet aroma with fairly hard roasted malt, caramel and coffe notes. Sweet flavor with hard roasted malt, caramel, liquerice and coffee notes.

[on tap at brewpub]
Coffee and mocha in the nose with still some sweet malt and subtle hops.  Almost opaque black with a tan top.  More lagery flavour than this brewer’s other beers together with a nice, gentle roast.  Dry and slightly sherry-like.  Medium body with low carbonation and a lasting black malt bitterness.

On tap at the brewpub: Literally black, smaller off-white head with a good lace; distinctive dry coffeeeish to roast-malty nose; light bodied, sweetish roasty flavour; lingering coffeeish-bitter finish with traces of liquorice. Good, good, good........
(6/27/08) Draught at the brewpub in Plzen. Almost black-colored with a medium beige head. Aroma of roastiness and notes of coffee. Sweetish  roasty flavor with some coffee. Medium-bodied.

(Draught) Pours almost black. The aroma is light to medium roasted with tones of mild coffee, chocolate, vanilla and grassy/herbal/floral hops. Undertones of dark berries. The flavour is medium roasted, medium bitter and light sweet with tones of coffee and some hops. The mouthfeel clean, light dry and a bit crisp. Light to medium bodied.
On tap @ Purkmistr brewpub. Very dark brown in colour with a medium sized head. Quite well balanced with notes of malt, toffee, dark fruit, bread and chocoalte.
Tap @ Purkmistr brewpub. Pours a nice dark almost black with a big yellowish head. Aroma of chocolate and roasted malt. Flavour is chocolate aswell, a bit creamy, but a little thin in the end.

Almost opaque dark nut brown color, good tan creamy head. Light lemony toasted aroma. Quite watery, light toasted caramelly flavor. Not diacetylic like many Czech dark lagers. Dry coffee in the aftertaste. Balanced, but pretty uninteresting.

Draught at the brewpub.
Dark brown, almost black coloured, medium sized pale brown head, light roasted coffee and chocolate nose. Roasted malt, caramel and coffee aroma with light smoked notes in the finish. Nice beer again.

Draught at the brewpub (thanks to Ogi and Maja for the lunch and the beers!) Very dark brown/black body, creamy off white head that went away somewhat fast. Nice coffeeish nose, finely roasty. some honeyish malt too and raisins.  Creamy, roasty taste, coffee again, some chicory, a touch of refreshingly lemony hops. A very good dunkel.

Draft at the brewpub. A dark brown beer with a lazing brown head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel and roasted malt, as well as light notes of smoke. The flavor is very sweet and very malty with notes of roasted malt, leading to a dry roasted finish. I find it somewhat porter-like.

Draught at the brewpub. 
Dark brown colour with tint of red. Little cocoa powder and slight coffee in aroma. Smooth mouthfeel with cocoa, coffee and toast. Solid beer.

Draught at The Purkmistr brewpub, Plzen-Cernice. Black with brown hue, tan head. Interesting smokiness on the malt, faint but there giving a bitterness on the palate. Pretty dry with liquorice and coffee flavours, finishing with bonfire notes. My best of the weekend so far.

Tap @ Purkmistr brewpub.
Pours almost black with a great, staying, creamy light-beige head. Sweet, lightly roasty aroma with subdued coffee. High carbonation. Flavour is pleasantly rounded, sweet roasted malt dominating. Light coffee notes. Super aftertaste of light chocolate. Long, good hoppiness. Nice.

Draught. Deep ambery brown colour, small off-white head. Aroma is burnt wood, coffee, roast, some caramel malts. Flavour is much the same in a very balanced mix of voffee and roasted malts. Quite dry finish.

(Draught at the brew pub)On June 27, 2008)Clear dark brown to black color, light tan head. Sweet caramel, also a bit roasted scent. Nice to not smell butterscotch for once. Malty, carmel and roasted taste. Coffee dry aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.

On tap at Purkmistr brew pub.  Very dark brown/black, thick tan head.  Lovely aroma of roasted malt.  Good in mouth, smooth, like a smooth stout.  Not too toasty roasty, bit of liquorice and charcoal.

From tap at the brewpub, I had this down as Tmave Lezak. Pours dark brown with a minor orange glare and a creamy tan head. Solid roasted malt aroma with a mild acidity showing through. Light annis seed like note. Flavour is hardroasted malt with a mild liqourice note. Ends nicely roasted and light.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2013 Brownish black with a thick and creamy off-white head. Roast malt, licorice and caramel in the aroma. Dry and roast flavour with a charcoal note. Very rich beer with a delicious burned finish.
Tap at the brewpub. Alround rating: The roasty character is subtle and adds choc and coffee notes, carbonation is good and makes for easy drinking.

Draught at the brewpub. Dark opaque brown, almost black, with a red edge, and with medium-sized creamy beige head. Nice roasted coffee aroma with some fudge and earthy, dusty hops. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Dry and bitter, and slightly acidic.
on tap at the brewpub. Black colour, small head. Aroma of caramel and coffee. Full malty body with lots of coffee flavours, also hints of wild berries, caramel, roasted malts, toffee...

on tap at the brewpub. close to black with some mahogany catching the light, huge inverted head which is beige around the rim of the glass and snow white in the centre. aroma of chlorine, czech porridge, tapioca pudding and molasses. some roasted flavours - soy sauce, aero bars, light burnt bitterness and a touch of chocolate cream. a bit messy, needs a little fine tuning

Draught at Monks Café, Stockholm.  Very dark brown, minimal beige head. Medium bodied with excesseive carbonation. Light velvette roasty malt with a touch of lemon on a distance. Butter and caramel along with tobacco wakes up as it warms. Low bitterness. Restrained sweetness makes it quite drinkable.

Dark brown body, very creamy light brown head, thick lacing; Very mineral nose, some plain white sugar aroma, some malt; Quite soft a bit thin texture, big bubbled carbonation, little bitterness and little sweetness; A bit to short finish with some caramel malty sweet aromas.
